diagnosis_text: Given your fluctuating weakness, ocular symptoms, fatigability with improvement on rest, and positive AChR antibodies, this points to myasthenia gravis. DIAGNOSIS READY: Myasthenia gravis (AChR antibody–positive)
doctor_hist:
How long have these symptoms been present, and do they fluctuate or worsen later in the day?

I've been experiencing these symptoms for about a month now. They do tend to worsen after physical activity, but I notice they improve after I rest for a while.

Do your eyelids droop, and does your double vision or weakness improve after briefly resting or with ice?

I haven't noticed my eyelids drooping, but my double vision and weakness do improve after resting. Ice hasn't made a difference for me.

Do you have trouble swallowing, speaking, or shortness of breath?

I haven't had any trouble swallowing or speaking, and I don't experience shortness of breath. My main issues are with the double vision and weakness in my arms and legs.

REQUEST TEST: Tensilon_Test (edrophonium)

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

Do your symptoms improve after a few seconds of sustained upward gaze rest or after a brief nap?

Yes, I've noticed that my symptoms improve after a brief nap or if I hold my gaze upward for a bit. It’s almost like resting helps reset things for me.

REQUEST TEST: Acetylcholine_Receptor_Antibodies (AChR) and MuSK_Antibodies

RESULTS: Acetylcholine_Receptor_Antibodies: Present (elevated) MuSK_Antibodies: NORMAL READINGS

doctor_hist:
Can you describe how your ataxia started—sudden or gradual onset?

It started gradually over the past few weeks. At first, I just noticed I was tripping more often, but now it feels like I can't walk straight at all.

Have you had headaches, vision changes, nausea, or new weakness?

I haven't had any headaches or vision changes, but I have felt a bit nauseous lately. The new weakness in my right arm is definitely concerning, though.

Have you had any recent infections, fever, or ear symptoms?

No, I haven’t had any recent infections or fever, and my ears seem fine. I haven't noticed any issues with my hearing either.

Have you had any recent head trauma, new medications, alcohol use changes, or exposure to toxins?

I haven't had any head trauma, and I haven't changed my medications or alcohol intake. I also don’t think I've been exposed to any toxins recently.

Have you noticed speech slurring, trouble swallowing, or double vision?

I haven't noticed any speech slurring or trouble swallowing, but I do feel a bit off-balance. No episodes of double vision either.

Have you had unintended weight loss, night sweats, or a history of cancer?

I haven’t experienced any unintended weight loss or night sweats, and I don’t have a history of cancer. My appetite seems okay, but I do feel a bit fatigued.

REQUEST TEST: Brain_MRI_with_contrast

RESULTS: MRI Brain findings show lesions consistent with Progressive Multifocal Encephalopathy (PML). T1/T2 images display multifocal demyelinating lesions without gadolinium enhancement, indicative of PML. Other vital signs and neurological examination reveal normothermic temperature, normal blood pressure, heart rate, and respiratory rate, with ataxic gait and weakness in right upper limb (4/5 strength).

DIAGNOSIS READY: Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy (PML)

Other vital signs and neurological examination reveal normothermic temperature, normal blood pressure, heart rate, and respiratory rate, with ataxic gait and weakness in right upper limb (4/5 strength).

doctor_hist:
Can you describe his bowel movements—frequency, stool consistency, and any delayed passage of meconium after birth?

He's been having normal bowel movements, but I haven't noticed any straining or discomfort when he goes. The consistency seems fine to me. No issues with meconium passage after birth—everything was normal there.

Any vomiting, especially bilious or projectile, and any failure to thrive or weight loss?

No vomiting at all, just some fussiness during feeding. He seems to be gaining weight, but it's definitely less eating than usual.

Any respiratory symptoms (cough, wheeze, choking with feeds) or frequent spit-ups suggestive of reflux or aspiration?

No respiratory symptoms noted, and he hasn't had any choking episodes. There have been a few spit-ups, but nothing concerning, just the usual after feeding.

Any abdominal exam findings—palpable masses, organomegaly, tenderness, or visible peristalsis?

He's been pretty fussy when his abdomen is touched, and it feels a bit distended. I don't notice any masses, but he definitely reacts strongly when I press on his belly.

Does the abdominal distension fluctuate with time or improve after passing gas or stool?

It seems to stay pretty consistent, but it does look a little better after he passes gas or has a bowel movement. He might seem a bit more comfortable then.

Any fevers, recent illnesses, or sick contacts?

No fevers or recent illnesses that I know of. He hasn't been around anyone who's been sick either. Everything else seems normal in that regard.

Any urinary symptoms—decreased wet diapers, foul-smelling urine, or crying with urination?

No issues with urination; he's had plenty of wet diapers and no strong smells. He doesn’t seem to cry or show discomfort when urinating either.

Any signs of food intolerance—rash, blood/mucus in stool, or fussiness tied to specific formulas/foods?

No signs of any rashes or blood in the stool. He hasn't reacted poorly to any specific formula or food that I've noticed either. Just the fussiness during feeding time.

REQUEST TEST: Abdominal_Ultrasound

RESULTS: NORMAL READINGSThis is the final question. Please provide a diagnosis.


DIAGNOSIS READY: Infantile colic
